alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 11:23AM EDT until May 04 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings are extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Lamprey River near Newmarket. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EDT Wednesday was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
